answers.author: Pamela Muse
answers.text:
Rebecca - the City of Concord, CA (126,000 population) owns the Concord Pavilion which is 12,500 seating capacity out door amphitheater. They outsource the Pavilion and sell naming rights; currently it's called "Sleep Train Pavilion at Concord" - http://www.livenation.com/venues/14806/sleep-train-pavilion-at-concord
I used to work there; not sure who the contact is anyone but I'd start with the City Manager's Office at 925-671-3000.
Good luck!
Pam

answers.author: Frank Lancaster
answers.text:
Larimer County Colorado operates a similar size events center, the Budweiser Events Center, in Loveland.  It's part of their fairgrounds complex.  The events center is operated in partnership with Global Spectrum, a Comcast company.  The county director of the complex is Bob Herrfeldt.  I'm sure he'd be happy to help you.  bherrfeldt@larimer.org

author: Rebecca Vice
text:
The City of Allen owns and operates a 8,100+ capacity event center. We are looking to compare other publicly operated event centers and how many FTE’s are City/public employees vs. contract/3rd party employees. Specific information that would be helpful would be:

The capacity of the event center
Average number of events held on an annual basis
The total # of FTE’s on the city/county/etc. payroll
title: City-owned and operated Event Center
